identity.name: QIRLLO
design_principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Swiss Grid precision with Nigerian warmth
Content is King: Data legibility is the primary aesthetic
Mobile First: Design for the teacher standing in a classroom with a phone
Negative Space: Use whitespace to reduce cognitive load in data-heavy views

headings.usage: Page titles, card headers, major stats

mono.usage: Student IDs, Grade calculations, Technical data

rules: No horizontal scrolling for primary actions
Use Bottom Sheets (Drawers) for forms/details instead of full page navigations where possible
Navigation: Bottom Tab Bar for main views
Dense data tables with comfortable padding (py-3 px-4)

GradeBook.mobile_behavior: List of student cards. Tap to open Drawer for grade entry.
GradeBook.desktop_behavior: Spreadsheet-style data grid with keyboard navigation.

ResultCard.style: Paper-like texture, official looking typography, clear pass/fail indicators

StatCard.style: Clean, minimal, with trend indicator. No heavy shadows.

visual_enhancers.textures: Subtle noise on solid backgrounds to reduce digital flatness
visual_enhancers.shadows: Soft, diffuse shadows (shadow-sm, shadow-md). Avoid harsh outlines.
visual_enhancers.borders: 1px solid borders in neutral-200 for structure. Rounded-lg (8px) radius.

teacher_dashboard_promo.usage: Landing page or empty state for teacher dashboard

accessibility.contrast: Ensure WCAG AA compliance for all text
accessibility.screen_readers: All icon-only buttons must have aria-label

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'GradeBook' component with distinct mobile/desktop views using 'react-responsive' or CSS media queries.
Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'Public Sans' for body text. Import from Google Fonts.
Ensure the 'Login' page uses the 'login_hero' image in a split layout (Image Left/Right, Form opposite).
For the Teacher Dashboard, prioritize the 'My Classes' and 'Grade Entry' flows.
universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for text.
Ensure all forms have validation feedback.
